result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dayna G Johnson

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

2:59 PM Prosecuting attorney Lexi Keyes in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Dayna G Johnson in court. Court explained the process to the defn. Defn has not spoke to SPD yet. He advised he may be able to get a lawyer through his organization but hasn't been able to make phone call through the jail. Defn waived time limits for prelim. Discussion re: defn's bail mtn. Court will not hear bail mtn today to allow defn time to discuss with an atty.
Status conference scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Bail/bond hearing on October 25, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Cash bond is set in the amount of $2,500 (per case). If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. 
The following checked category(s) are also ordered: _x_ GPS, _x_ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing. 
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor. 
- Defendant shall not consume or possess alcohol. 
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon [as defined by Wis. Stat. 939.22(10)]. 
- Defendant shall not possess any type of knife, axe, or bow. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Sheila R. 
- Defendant shall not be at any residence of Sheila R. 
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial Judge - Br 14
Referral to Dane County Pretrial Services (DCPS)

1:33 PM Defendant Dayna G Johnson in court, in custody.  Attorney Paul M Fredrickson in court for Dayna G Johnson.  Prosecuting attorney Kyle Olsen in court for the State of Wisconsin. Appearance by victim via Zoom. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts. Statement by victim.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 25, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
